__e: It's one thing to make a fool out of yourself, but it's another thing to make a fool out of the police department and the town.
Oh, I don't suppose you'll believe this, Bonet but this morning, in the church there, I tried to make a fool out of you.
Is she finished messing with us?
Or was it too much fun making a fool of me that you couldn't reveal your secret?
Is she finished messing with us?
Oh, I don't suppose you'll believe this, Bonet but this morning, in the church there, I tried to make a fool out of you.
You look around at all the people, and you realise you're dealing with a government that's fooled everyone.
Because if you're not, then you've made fools of both of us.
Well, if that's the case, then I've been played for an even bigger fool than I thought.
Well, I think I've made a silly fool of myself this morning.
I think I've been making a bit of a fool of myself,
You're not sorry at all, you're just sorry you made a fool of yourself.
But speak like this and they call you a madman.
You understand I need to be certain that you and he are not playing me for a fool.
Be certain this is the last time you make a fool of me, savage!
I made a fool of myself tonight... and it's not the first time.
If you are determined to make a fool of yourself, I shall oversee it.
Not satisfied with messing yourselves up in New York, have to come here.
Who are these two fools, and what are they doing in my house?
Soon it will be from Baumettes that you won't go out... ever.
